column4: Remember, that speed is not just determinent on software, also your connection, router, number of peers, and how fast they're connections are
use a popular torrent with a low # of leechers, and test among different clients
I know, thus why I suggested he use the same torrent file for each client.
I already ointed him that way
My apologies. :)
sorry for sounding like a *** lol I just noticed that
Haha, no I didn't think you sounded like one. I understand -- I would have done the same thing. Totally understandable.
but if you just joined the channel you didn't know lol
Yeah I did. I usually wait and watch a bit but msot people don't invoke the bot much so botting is usually a safe bet. I should have stayed back though, so no hard feelings man. :)
silverarrow, correct, but the ones on the repos have been tested for compatability. so to ensure compatability, get the repo one
silverarrow: Right. It may be a little old but it'll at least work.
silverarrow, if you get the "newest" one, it may have bugs and that may be the reason ubuntu hasnt hosted it on the the repos
I agree. :) Pain in the patootie lol
correction, typing to fast
no
Zeu5, dont use $USER
Zeu5, $USER is ubuntu be ecause your using the CD, type type: sudo chown (username on your other operating system) /path/to/ice
yes, $USER replaces $USER with the current logged in user when you run it, just like $PATH is replaced by executable directories
Hmph. Didn't know that. I guess that's what I get from working with PHP. :/ I'll keep that in mind, though. Thanks for the heads-up
try it, go into terminal and type $USER and hit enter
I figured it out. ;)
he doesnt need to be confused at the moment
I agree. Just telling him not to worry
